intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow. This is Cheve? If Ryoma is here, he's probably not in dire need of our help.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Actually, Corrin, Cheve is still inland from here. This place is called Cyrkensia. It belongs to the kingdom of Nestra. Nestra is another neutral kingdom, Like Izumo. As you can see, this city is known for leisure. People from both Nohr and Hoshido vacation here, even in times of war.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ah. Well, it certainly seems lively!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes. You'd hardly know there's a war going on elsewhere...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Let's hope it stays that way.

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Hey, guys! You're humans, right? Are you from Hoshido? My name's Kaden!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Excuse me?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: You know, humans? Like, you don't have fuzzy tails or ears? And you don't transform into any other creatures?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well...yes and no.

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Aww, you're not going to answer my questions? That's rude!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No, I'm sorry. It's just that...it's complicated. And as to whether we're from Hoshido... Also complicated. Sorry that I can't be more specific right now. May I ask who—and what—you are?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Corrin, he's a kitsune—a Hoshidan tribe with shapeshifting abilities.

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Yup! That's exactly it. I can turn into a fox! Wanna see?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Kaden, what are you doing so far from home? I thought kitsune didn't leave the village for any reason.

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Yeah, that's true. But I'm a little different, I guess. I'm here to return a favor for someone. Anytime someone's nice to me, I have to be nice in return. One day, I walked out of my village and met some humans. And they were so excellent to me! I had to find a way to repay them. That led me to meet more humans, who were also super nice. One favor led to another, and I wound up here without even knowing how I got here.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: So...you're actually lost?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Nah, kitsune never get lost.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: All right. Let me put it another way. Do you know how to get home?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: No. I don't. But I can't go home yet anyway! I owe someone here a big favor. Hmm... Maybe you guys could help me out... It kind of seems like a human problem, so I don't really know what to do. Here, can you talk to my new friend about it? Her name's Layla.

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: *sob*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh. Um, hello. How can we help you?

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: I don't think that you can...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Please, try us. We've just arrived, so we have a little time before we have to move on. I know we don't owe you anything, but we'd like to help.

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: Very well. My mother lives in a small village a few miles from here. She's old and frail, and I'm told the end could come at any moment. I really need to go and see her right away, but there's a problem... I'm a singer, and I have a performance scheduled today...for King Garon.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods! King Garon is here now?

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: Yes. He visits the area often, and he always requests a performance from me. But how can I sing at a time like this?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I believe that we can help. I can perform in your stead.

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: Do you really think that will work?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm not sure about this, Azura.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Don't you see, Corrin? This is our chance to take the enemy by surprise. We shouldn't waste the opportunity!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hmm. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Uh, guys? Can you not tell that these two look COMPLETELY different? I mean, I know you don't have sweet fox vision like me, but...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Kaden, we have a mage traveling with us who can make me look exactly like Layla. Your decision to accept Zola is looking quite sage now, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Wait, what do you want me to do?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: You heard me, Zola. While King Garon is distracted by my song, others can approach undetected. If we capture Garon, Nohr would have no choice but to negotiate for peace.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: I don't know. Garon would DEFINITELY kill me if he found out...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I thought you were on our side now, Zola. We need you! We are trying to end the war as peacefully as we can. Don't you see that?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Ugh... I understand. I'll do it. The Nohrians will see Lady Azura as Layla. However, you must understand that my spell won't change her voice! I hope you've got some good pipes, Lady Azura!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh, rest assured... Azura is an incredible singer.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: That's right. This wouldn't be the first time she's mesmerized a crowd with her voice.

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: Well...if you say so. I would be so grateful for the chance to see my mother. Are you really sure about all this? If you fail, King Garon is going to be really mad...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Don't worry about us. Just go see your mother while you still can. And thank you for providing us this opportunity.

intro.speaker: Layla
intro.line: All right. Good luck!

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Yay! I think Layla and I are even. But...now I owe you guys. Wow! I've really got myself in a pickle with this whole favor thing... Do you think I could tag along with you humans until I figure out how to repay you?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kaden, you do realize that we're in the middle of a war, right?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Yeah, that sounds crazy and exciting! Did I already tell you that I can turn into a big, scary fox? It's so great!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: And do you have any combat experience as a fox?

intro.speaker: Kaden
intro.line: Ha! Take a look at this beaststone. It makes me super fierce.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well. I suspect you'll be able to repay your supposed debt to us rather quickly.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Everyone, we don't have much time left before the show s-starts...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Right. Zola, time to work your magic...

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: The show's starting...where's King Garon?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't know... Ah, look up there. In the roped-off area. I haven't seen him since the attack. I still can't believe this is happening.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Who's that sitting next to him?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Maybe this music will help distract me from all the awful things going on...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's Elise, my sister. She looks so sad. She was such a bright and cheerful girl before all this happened... Poor Elise. I'm so sorry for choosing to stand against you. When all of this is over, I hope you'll understand the decisions I made...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Ahem...

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Tell me, Father. What sorts of things does this performer sing about?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Does it matter? Her voice is divine. Just sit back and enjoy the show.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: All right...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That song? No, Azura! What are you doing?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't believe it. It's working! The Nohrian soldiers are enthralled by the song. Now's our chance! Soldiers of Hoshido, gather yourselves--

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Well, well, well. Just what do you think you're doing, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gah!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Capture them, men!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: There are so many of them...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Did you really think you could outsmart me, Corrin? Pathetic.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: What are they going to do to my Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: How fascinating. Despite your treason and betrayal, you still seem to care about your sister.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't understand. How could you have anticipated this?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Ah, Corrin. Your naiveté is embarrassing. I still can't believe you willingly allowed one of my men to travel with you.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Eek! King Garon, what are you doing? They didn't need to know that!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Zola was behind this? But he proved his loyalty!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: That's right. I could be dead if it weren't for him.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: What better way to convince you all? I knew a healer would be nearby.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: You filthy rat! I'll kill you myself!

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: So...Your Majesty. I've followed through on my end of the deal... Can you please tell Lord Leo not to kill me after all? And, um, while you're at it... Would it inconvenience you terribly to pardon Lord/Lady Corrin? The Hoshidans have practically brainwashed him/her! This isn't his/her fault.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What's the matter, Zola? Conscience bothering you?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Please, King Garon! I beg you!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: This grows tiresome.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Wait...but...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: But nothing! You think you have the right to ask ME for anything?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Gyaah!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Father! What are you doing?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Ugh...Lord/Lady Corrin...please forgive me...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That was heartless.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Still you pity a...creature...such as that! One who betrayed you, nonetheless! This is the source of your weakness.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Do you really think it's OK to use people as you see fit and then dispose of them? How admirable.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I'll show you weakness. Just come within range of my bow...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No. We can't make a stand here. There are too many of them. We need to escape and regroup. Everyone, make for that exit!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: It looks like they’re sending in more reinforcements…

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: So it’s come to this. You dare to point your sword at our king… The same man you once called Father.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Please understand, milord! Lord/Lady Corrin’s actions are justified! King Garon’s dark ambition is the sole cause of this war. Unless we stop him, both kingdoms with continue to suffer.

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: I will not. You have betrayed our family, and as such, deserve a traitor’s fate. Draw your sword, Corrin, and we’ll settle this once and for all. Go on! If you would oppose us, then kill your brother with your own hands! Destroy the very friends and soldiers who once protected you!

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Corrin! There's an escape route behind the stage! Hurry! Before they overwhelm us…

boss.speaker: Garon
boss.line: Are you actually attempting to engage me in battle? Very well. Do your best!

boss.speaker: Garon
boss.line: Hmpf. This is a waste of time. My men can take it from here.

boss.speaker: Xander
boss.line: How reckless. Corrin hasn't prepared you for this fight. Well, his/her failings will be your undoing. Prepare to die.

boss.speaker: Peri
boss.line: I'm gonna bring your guts back to Lord Xander! Teeheehee!

boss.speaker: Peri
boss.line: Huh...that's strange. Usually, I'm the one doing the stabbing and killing. I need to retreat and think about this...

boss.speaker: Laslow
boss.line: Hey! Don't look at me like that!

boss.speaker: Laslow
boss.line: Blast. I hope Xander doesn't restrict my leisure time for this...

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: You're not my father, and you never were. Prepare to die.

boss.speaker: Garon
boss.line: I may not be your father, but I will slap you down like a child. This foolishness ends now!

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: Brother, this is madness.

boss.speaker: Xander
boss.line: I’m not your brother anymore. Put that notion out of your head. By your own choice, we are enemies now. Prepare to fight!

boss.speaker: Peri
boss.line: Ooh! I found you, you little traitor!

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I am not a traitor! King Garon is a tyrant! And who are you, anyway?

boss.speaker: Peri
boss.line: Not a traitor? But Lord Xander said you were... I'm Peri! No offense, but I'm going to kill you now.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: None taken. Wait, what am I saying?

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: Who are you? I don't remember you from the castle....

boss.speaker: Laslow
boss.line: Oh, that's too bad. I've always had the highest opinion of you. I'm Laslow, one of Lord Xander's retainers.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: And I suppose you're here to stop me like the others...

boss.speaker: Laslow
boss.line: Yes, per Lord Xander's orders. It does seem unfortunate.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: *sigh*

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: *huff* *huff* I...I think we’re safe here.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: You can’t escape from me, Corrin.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Brother!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: You’ve gotten stronger, little prince/princess. But not strong enough. You have betrayed not only your king but your whole family. To think...I once called you Brother/Sister and loved you with all my heart…

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Xander! Corrin! Please stop what you’re doing!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Elise! What are you doing?

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Stand back, Elise. Leave this to me.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: No! I won’t let you hurt Corrin. If you must fight someone...fight me!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Elise, please. Don’t do this.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Quickly—Elise has distracted Xander. Now’s our chance! We have to cut our losses and run. Fighting here put the innocent people of Nestra at risk.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Hurry, Corrin!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Argh!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: That’s right. Run away while you can. I will always find you, little prince/princess. It is your destiny to face me…

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I think we really did shake them this time.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes. For now. But we’re eventually going to have to settle things once and for all with Xander. I’ve got a lot of work to do before I’ll be his equal in battle.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: You’re right. I’ve also got a long way to go.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Still, we should take advantage of this chance to rest. We won’t get many. Have you seen Azura? I want to make sure she gets the message.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Hmm, I saw her a minute ago… Ah, she’s right over there. Behind that tree.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thanks, Takumi. Tend to your wounds, and rest well. I’ll talk to you later.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hello, Azura. Is everything OK?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: UNNGH…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Whoa, what’s wrong?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: *huff* *huff* Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, it’s me! What’s going on? Are you hurt?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No, no. I’m fine. Please, don’t worry…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You really don’t seem fine. Wait here. I’ll go get Sakura.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No! Really, I’m fine. I just...need a moment.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Are you sure? You look exhausted.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. I suppose I am. Thank you for your concern. Really, though. I’m starting to feel better…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: All right…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Come on, we should get going. Ryoma is still out there somewhere.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Wait, Azura—

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Damn.
